citation.article-title: Sulfuritalea hydrogenivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a facultative autotroph isolated from a freshwater lake
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sulfuritalea hydrogenivorans sp. nov.
Sulfuritalea hydrogenivorans (hy.dro.ge.ni.vo′rans. N.L. n. hydrogenum hydrogen; L. part. adj. vorans consuming; N.L. part. hydrogenivorans hydrogen-consuming).
Facultatively anaerobic and can reduce nitrate to nitrogen.
Autotrophic growth occurs with oxidation of thiosulfate, elemental sulfur and hydrogen.
Heterotrophic growth occurs on acetate, benzoate, butyrate, fumarate, isobutyrate, lactate, malate, propionate, pyruvate and succinate.
Grows at 8–32 °C and pH 6.4–7.6, with optimum growth at 25 °C and pH 6.7–6.9.
The type strain, sk43HT ( = DSM 22779T = NBRC 105852T), was isolated from water of a stratified freshwater lake.
The DNA G+C content is 67 mol%.
